|flash1type = eMMC |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Samsung;KLMBG2JETD-B041; |flash1size = 32 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Trolink TML1512AA |rad1modif = SDIO 3.0 |rad1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8189ES; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "BIGTREETECH_CB1_eMMC_V1.1" is silkscreened on board top.
Note: This SoM has limited compatibility with [[Raspberry Pi Compute Module 4 (CM4104032)|Raspberry Pi CM4]] :[[SeeedStudio Dual Gigabit CM4 Carrier Board|Carrier boards]] as it lacks PCI and USB 3.0 capabilities.
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: [[Allwinner]] H616 @1.5GHz :Quad-Core ARM (Cortex-A53) *GPU: ''Mali-G31 MP2'', supports :OpenGL ES 1.0/2.0/3.2, OpenCL 2.0 *Storage: 32GB (eMMC) Flash *Memory: 1GB (DDR3L) SDRAM *Wi-Fi: [[Realtek]] RTL8189ES :802.11bgn (1T1R) â€¢ [[Trolink]] *Network: 1x FE port via connectors *Power Source: 5V via connectors
==Links of Interest== *[https://github.com/bigtreetech/CB1 ''Bigtreetech/CB1'' on '''GitHub'''] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2022/10/20/bigtreetech-cb1-a-raspberry-pi-cm4-compatible-allwinner-h616-system-on-module/ ''BIGTREETECH CB1 - A Raspberry Pi CM4 compatible'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[https://jamesachambers.com/bigtreetech-cb1-cm4-alternative-w-pi4b-adapter-review/ ''BIGTREETECH CB1 (CM4 Alternative) w/ Pi4B Adapter Review'' on '''Blog''']
